Posts.Content: The cancer smell is in fact the smell of 'rotting flesh' which is happening with the cancer eating it. I have a friend with breast cancer.  She's had if for years and done nothing with it.  Is very proud of surviving so long without the chemo etc (although I would have had it removed in same situation - but not the chemo) The trouble is now - it is all I can do is stand near her.  If I  have her in - the smell invades the whole house ,  I have just opened front and back doors to try and get rid of it and don't know how I can manage further meetings without her knowing how badly it is affecting me.  It's an awful sweet fruity sickly smell and strong even outside in a strong wind.   It is very sad I don't know how much long she has to go.
Posts.Title: Cancer smell

Posts.Content: Well the situation that I was posting about was of a friend that has advanced breast cancer  with the smell like a dead body = of 'rotting flesh' I never noticed it for years until she has reached this advanced stage. I really dont't understand a smell in it's very early stages because it isn't rotting at all in this stage
Posts.Title: Cancer smell

Posts.Content: The smell is of rotting flesh as of someone deceased for a few days Described like pungent 'sweet fruity' smell that permeates everything and very hard to get rid of even when the person has left
